verses.verse: "Oh <S%H4310><s%> <S%H5414><s%> that you were like a brother <S%H251><s%> to me Who nursed <S%H3243><s%> at my mother's breasts. <S%H7699><s%> [If] I found <S%H4672><s%> you outdoors, <S%H2351><s%> I would kiss <S%H5401><s%> you; No <S%H3808><s%> one would despise <S%H936><s%> me, either. <S%H1571><s%>

"I would lead <S%H5090><s%> you [and] bring <S%H935><s%> you Into the house <S%H1004><s%> of my mother, <S%H517><s%> who used to instruct <S%H3925><s%> me; I would give <S%H8248><s%> you spiced <S%H7544><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> to drink <S%H8248><s%> from the juice <S%H6071><s%> of my pomegranates. <S%H7416><s%>
"Let his left <S%H8040><s%> hand <S%H8040><s%> be under <S%H8478><s%> my head, <S%H7218><s%> And his right <S%H3225><s%> hand <S%H3225><s%> embrace <S%H2263><s%> me."

"I want you to swear, <S%H7650><s%> O daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> Do not arouse <S%H5782><s%> or awaken <S%H5782><s%> [my] love, <S%H160><s%> Until <S%H5704><s%> she pleases. <S%H2654><s%>"

"Who <S%H4310><s%> is this <S%H384><s%> coming <S%H5927><s%> up from the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> Leaning <S%H7514><s%> on her beloved <S%H1730><s%>?" "Beneath <S%H8478><s%> the apple <S%H8598><s%> tree <S%H8598><s%> I awakened <S%H5782><s%> you; There <S%H8033><s%> your mother <S%H517><s%> was in labor <S%H9111><s%> with you, There <S%H8033><s%> she was in labor <S%H9111><s%> [and] gave <S%H3205><s%> you birth. <S%H3205><s%>

"Put <S%H7760><s%> me like a seal <S%H2368><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> your heart, <S%H3820><s%> Like a seal <S%H2368><s%> on your arm. <S%H2220><s%> For love <S%H160><s%> is as strong <S%H5794><s%> as death, <S%H4194><s%> Jealousy <S%H7068><s%> is as severe <S%H7186><s%> as Sheol; <S%H7585><s%> Its flashes <S%H7565><s%> are flashes <S%H7565><s%> of fire, <S%H784><s%> The [very] flame <S%H7957><s%> of the Lord. <S%H3050><s%>

"Many <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> cannot <S%H3201><s%> <S%H3808><s%> quench <S%H3518><s%> love, <S%H160><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> will rivers <S%H5104><s%> overflow <S%H7857><s%> it; If <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> were to give <S%H5414><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the riches <S%H1952><s%> of his house <S%H1004><s%> for love, <S%H160><s%> It would be utterly <S%H936><s%> despised. <S%H936><s%>"

"We have a little <S%H6996><s%> sister, <S%H269><s%> And she has <S%H369><s%> no <S%H369><s%> breasts; <S%H7699><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> shall we do <S%H6213><s%> for our sister <S%H269><s%> On the day <S%H3117><s%> when <S%H7945><s%> she is spoken <S%H1696><s%> for?

"If <S%H518><s%> she is a wall, <S%H2346><s%> We shall build <S%H1129><s%> on her a battlement <S%H2918><s%> of silver; <S%H3701><s%> But if <S%H518><s%> she is a door, <S%H1817><s%> We shall barricade <S%H6696><s%> her with planks <S%H3871><s%> of cedar. <S%H730><s%>"

"I was a wall, <S%H2346><s%> and my breasts <S%H7699><s%> were like towers; <S%H4026><s%> Then <S%H227><s%> I became <S%H1961><s%> in his eyes <S%H5869><s%> as one who finds <S%H4672><s%> peace. <S%H7965><s%>

"Solomon <S%H8010><s%> had <S%H1961><s%> a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> at Baal-hamon; He entrusted <S%H5414><s%> the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to caretakers; <S%H5201><s%> Each <S%H376><s%> one <S%H376><s%> was to bring <S%H935><s%> a thousand <S%H505><s%> [shekels] of silver <S%H3701><s%> for its fruit. <S%H6529><s%>

"My very <S%H7945><s%> own vineyard <S%H3754><s%> is at my disposal; <S%H6440><s%> The thousand <S%H505><s%> [shekels] are for you, Solomon, <S%H8010><s%> And two hundred <S%H3967><s%> are for those who take <S%H5201><s%> care <S%H5201><s%> of its fruit. <S%H6529><s%>"
"O you who sit <S%H3427><s%> in the gardens, <S%H1588><s%> [My] companions <S%H2270><s%> are listening <S%H7181><s%> for your voice <S%H6963><s%> â€“ Let me hear <S%H8085><s%> it!"

"Hurry, <S%H1272><s%> my beloved, <S%H1730><s%> And be like <S%H1819><s%> a gazelle <S%H6643><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a young <S%H6082><s%> stag <S%H354><s%> On the mountains <S%H2022><s%> of spices. <S%H1314><s%>"
